bitbuster

The bitbuster module gives you depack support for data packed using the bitbuster algorithm.

FUNCTION NAMES

The functions depack and depack_raw are MODULE local, which means you have to add the prefix "bitbuster." to its name. This is to prevent possible name clashes with functions from other libraries you might be using.  However, if you define MAKE_BITBUSTER_GLOBAL then these functions will be available without the "bitbuster." prefix as well.

COPYRIGHT & CREDITS

This module has been released by Arjan Bakker under the MIT License; please see the top of the source file(s) for the full copyright statement.

Macros
MAKE_BITBUSTER_GLOBAL

Defining this will make all public functions that are normally only available with the "bitbuster." prefix to also be available without this prefix. See the introduction of bitbuster for more information.

BITBUSTER_OPTIMIZE_SPEED

Defining this will optimize the bitbuster depacker for speed, at the cost of bigger code.

Functions
depack

Depack a blob of data that was packed with Bitbuster.

ENTRY
HL

Address of packed data

DE

Address to depack to

EXIT
HL

Size of depacked data

A

Number of blocks left to decompress

FZ

Last block has been decompressed FNZ- Last block hasn't been decompressed

MODIFIES

#AF, BC, BC', DE, DE', HL, HL'#

depack_raw

Depack data that was packed with Bitbuster.  Decompresses the RAW data, i.e. the data that is stored after the block count and block size!

ENTRY
HL

Address of packed data

DE

Address to depack to

EXIT
HL

Address of first byte after compressed data

DE

Address of first byte after decompressed data

MODIFIES

#AF, BC, BC', DE, DE', HL, HL'#
